properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 1 at 10:01AM CST by NWS Jackson MS
properties.description:
...The National Weather Service in Jackson has issued a Flood Warning
for the following rivers in Mississippi...

Pearl River Near Rockport affecting Copiah and Simpson Counties
Pearl River Near Monticello affecting Lawrence County
Pearl River Near Columbia affecting Marion County
Strong River At D'lo affecting Simpson County

The National Weather Service in Jackson has issued a

* Flood Warning for
The Pearl River Near Columbia
* from Saturday evening until further notice.
* At  9:15 AM Wednesday the stage was 12.6 feet.
* Minor flooding is forecast.
* Flood stage is 17.0 feet.
* Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage Saturday evening
and will continue to rise to near 19.0 feet Monday morning.
* Impact...At 18.0 feet...Low areas along the river are inundated.
* Impact...At 17.0 feet...Low areas near the river begin to flood.
Water covers Old Highway 35 on the west side of the river.
* Impact...At 15.0 feet...Camp Lane Road south of columbia on the east
side of the river begins to flood.
properties.instruction:
Do not drive or walk through areas where water covers roadway! The
water may be deeper than it appears. Remember...Turn around, don't
drown!

Please note that forecast crests are based upon rainfall that has
occurred along with forecast rainfall for the next 48 hours. Rainfall amounts greater than forecast may take the rivers higher.


Additional information is available at:
https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=JAN

The next regularly scheduled update is expected tonight between 8 and
10 PM.
